newsitem.title: UK: HORSE RACING-BRITISH IN STRONG BREEDERS' CUP RAID.
newsitem.headline: HORSE RACING-BRITISH IN STRONG BREEDERS' CUP RAID.

text.p: Britain unveiled a 10-strong team on Thursday for the $10 million Breeders' Cup series, to be run a week on Saturday at Woodbine in Toronto, Canada.

The Breeders' Cup Mile, won last year by Ireland's Ridgewood Pearl, will again draw the most interest in Europe with Mark Of Esteem, the 2,000 Guineas and Queen Elizabeth II Stakes winner, leading the challenge.
Bookmakers Ladbrokes make Mark of Esteem the 4-5 favourite, shorter even than Cigar for the Classic.
He could be joined by stablemate Charnwood Forest, a winner at Newmarket on Thursday, and French colt Spinning World, winner of the Irish 2,000 Guineas.
European-trained horses have claimed eight of the 14 berths in the mile-and-a-half (2.4 km) Turf, five of them from Britain.
St Leger runner-up Dushyantor, Pilsudski, who was second to Helissio in the Prix de l'Arc de Triomphe, and Singspiel, a winner at Woodbine last month, are among those on target to run.
Ireland's only entrant, Zagreb, the runaway Irish Derby winner but an Arc failure, has made the Turf line-up while Andre Fabre looks to Arc fourth Swain and Luna Wells.
